info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 8 at 5:12PM EDT until September 8 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Miami FL
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast Florida, including the following counties, Broward and Palm Beach.
* WHEN...Until 615 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 512 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Boca Raton, Deerfield Beach, Coconut Creek, Parkland, Mission Bay, Hamptons At Boca Raton, Whisper Walk, Boca Pointe, Boca Del Mar, Loxahatchee NWR, South County Regional Park, Sandalfoot Cove, Hillsboro Pines, Boca West, Hillsboro Ranches and Fau South Campus. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EDT THIS EVENING
